Table of Contents

Class Feed

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Represents a subscribed RSS/Atom/JSON Feed source. Stores metadata, synchronization state, health indicators, caching info and retention rules. Optimized for efficient polling, conditional GET and low-bandwidth sync on constrained devices.

[Table("Feeds")]
public class Feed
Inheritance
object

object.ToString()

Remarks

This entity is central to feed management and includes:

  • Core feed metadata (URL, title, description, website)
  • Synchronization state (last update, next schedule, active status)
  • Health tracking (failure count, last error, ETag for conditional GET)
  • Content management (retention days, article counts)
  • Categorization and organization

Performance optimizations for low-resource environments:

  • Indexed fields: CategoryId, LastUpdated, NextUpdateSchedule
  • Cached article counts to avoid repeated aggregation queries
  • ETag and LastModified support for bandwidth-efficient updates

Constructors

Feed()

Initializes a new instance of the Feed class. Sets default values for timestamps, frequencies, and state properties.

Feed-specific override for article retention period in days. Null = use global default, 0 = keep forever.

ETag

ETag header value from the last successful HTTP response. Enables conditional GET (If-None-Match) to save bandwidth.

[MaxLength(512)]
public string? ETag { get; set; }

Effective retention period in days (feed-specific override or global default). Not persisted in database.

Number of consecutive failed update attempts. Used for exponential backoff and health visualization.

public int FailureCount { get; set; }
